text: I expected that the Philippines would be
this magical instant embrace my mom is
Filipina it ended up just overwhelming
me just a lot of bodies and vehicles in
movement jeepneys and motorcycles with
side cars I'm rather introverted I'm
rather careful and Manila is neither an
introverted nor careful City so I just
decided to hide slept a lot watched a
lot of pirated madman DVDs just kind of
stayed home I felt like I was failing
the Philippines I went out with some
other expat Americans and then this
person walked in she moved easily
wherever she was all of a sudden I knew
that I had a sea wall up against a lot
of things this person somehow breached
that sea wall completely we exchanged
numbers
I just remember noticing so much more
about the city just walking through it
next to this person I noticed people
nodding at us I noticed the security
guard just always said to her nice bike
it felt natural it felt safe if you're
courting a woman who's always riding a
bicycle it's always a mistake not to
have a bicycle I finally got my own I
took my place next to all of the
jeepneys and started to move from Manila
we traveled to a really lovely island
what's the island lightning in the
distance we played truth or truth in our
hotel room that's like I like you if you
want to date someone here that would
make me really happy she just kind of
smiled and she said it's complicated for
me right now I'm talking to someone in
the States
she mentioned that the person she was
talking to would be visiting her in a
few weeks I went to the bathroom bent
over and started to cry and I was just
like do not continue do not pass go she
just sat across from me and said she
didn't want to lose me yeah yeah and I
kissed her we spent the next few weeks
together and then two hours before her
person arrived from the states I got
into a cab and left her house I had this
bicycle of course it wouldn't fit into
my suitcase so I wheeled it down to the
bike shop it just turned around and then
when I turned back the bike was just a
complete mess of parts and one of them
put the bolts in my palm and he said
topless now which meant it's done
oh oh
